data.title: Add float Curve
data.body:
Godot has Curve3D, Curve2D, ColorRamp but no Curve for just floats. This would be handy for defining values changing over time in a determined and smooth way, or defining a custom interpolation.
For comparison, the Unity equivalent is AnimationCurve, and is used in a lot of places in the engine.

I currently need it so i can define the width of a line along its length (rather than having to set every single 50 points for example).

data.title: [TRACKER] HiDPI-related issues
data.body:
This is a tracker of issues related to displays with high DPI values.

- [ ] Very small project manager window size on hiDPI displays (https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/8543)
- [ ] More DPI scaling options should be available (https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/7293)
- [ ] Add a new vector-based default editor theme (https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/7294)
- [ ] HighDPI mode is scaling too much on high resolution display (Windows) (https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/6601)
- [ ] HiDPI automatically used on FullHD screens, makes the UI too big (https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/6096)
- [ ] HiDPI Screen option on Low DPI screen will break UI (https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/6130)
- [ ] Documentation to support HIDPI in project (https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/5916)

data.title: Add a new vector-based default editor theme
data.body:
A new, vector-based theme for the editor is required for good-looking hiDPI support. It should probably be drawn using Inkscape and be exportable to PNG with a script, just like the current icons.

Related issue: [UI Concept for Godot](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/2207)

data.title: More DPI scaling options should be available
data.body:
More DPI scales should be available to cater to the growing amount of hi-DPI displays.

Currently, we have:

- 75% (VeryLoDPI)
- 100% (LoDPI)
- 150% (MiDPI)
- 200% (HiDPI)

Following the Windows 10 scaling options, I suggest adding:

- 125%
- 175%
- 225%

This way, users with poor vision, medium-resolution displays or very high-resolution displays can enjoy a more natively-integrated Godot (compared to their OS scaling settings).

Additionally, the scaling percentage should probably be shown when selecting a DPI option (such as 150%), instead of just a named value. A "(recommended)" text could also show next to the automatically-detected DPI setting.

Lastly, it is probably worth it to regenerate all icons and editor graphics for each of those sizes, for optimal display on each of those sizes. With optimized PNGs, the size should hopefully not be too much of an issue.

data.title: OS-specific extensions are not default for exporting
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
win7x64, godot 2.1.1

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Export to win/mac/linux, and the filename is always whatever the previous export was, even for a different OS.  It should be no extension for linux, .zip for Mac (I think), and .exe for Windows.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Export to the above with the standard templates installed.

data.title: Mac OS X only-32 and only-64 not included in export template (only fat 32+64 is)
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
win7x64, godot 2.1.1

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Try to export project to 64-bit or 32-bit.  Alert says error exporting.  Command window says,

```
ERROR: EditorExportPlatformOSX::export_project: Requested template binary 'godot
_osx_release.64' not found. It might be missing from your template archive.
   At: platform\osx\export\export.cpp:424
ERROR: ProjectExportDialog::export_platform: Exporting failed!
   At: tools\editor\project_export.cpp:555
```

**Steps to reproduce:**
Install export templates.  Export.  Mac OSX.  Choose non-fat option for Bits Mode.  Hit Export.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):

data.title: Cross compiled export release templates for windows don't work
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Arch Linux 64bit - latest build


**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
The cross compiled release binary for windows doesn't work. It doesn't matter if it is the 32- or 64-bit version. I'm trying to run the exported game under Windows 10 (which runs in a VM), and it crashes. However, there is one difference: The 64 bit version crashes immediately, while the 32 bit version shows the title screen of the game and crashes when I press "start".
The game runs fine under Linux and in web. The cross compiled debug versions also work fine under Windows.

The fact that it does show the title screen when using the 32 bit version and doesn't when using the 64 bit version indicates that is has something to do with my game. But on the other hand, when it runs fine under linux and webgl (and the debug build), it should just work under Windows, shouldn't it?

I found this issue relating to that problem: #2189 But this has been fixed, if I didn't misread.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Compile godot under Linux. Cross compile Windows release templates. Copy them to template folder. Make a game. Export to Windows. Run under Windows.

data.title: RtAudio output underflow!
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10. Godot 2.0 -2.2 Alpha.

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Ever since I started using Godot (2.0 I think), I've received audio buffer underflows.

The debugger window simply gets (occasionally) spammed with this message:
`RtAudio output underflow!`

I'm not sure if it's caused by sound effects or music, but I get a "crack" in sounds / music whenever it happens.

I've got some integrated sound card (it's Acer Aspire E 13 laptop)

data.title: Added method set_hide_on_select to popup
data.body:
Added method set_hide_on_select to popup, in order to give us the ability to disable hide after selecting an item, such as on the Debug Options popup.

Should solve https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/7262, as well as give us the ability to disable hide on select on other popups.

data.title: Viewport issue using Canvaslayer and viewportsprite.
data.body:
Runing under Windows 7
When you place a viewport as a child of a canvas layer the render target breaks and you can't use the viewportsprite to render the viewport's texture.

1. Create a new Canvaslayer, after that create a new viewport inside the canvaslayer and set a sprite as a child of the viewport node.
2. Create a new viewportsprite and assing the viewport (inside or outside the canvaslayer is the same).

At this point the viewport stop working and the viewportsprite can't access to  the viewport's texture, also you can't call the viewport's texture from other canvaslayer using the viewportsprite (this method works just fine in versions before 2.1 stable).
Test Case Project:
https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B3mjAjcuXnKqZzBJQWlhQ2xrRm8

data.title: Added rad2vec and deg2vec functions
data.body: Implements #7263

data.title: [request] Tab Container node - get_current_tab_node_name
data.body:
I am trying to call a function on an object that I spawned inside the tab container node.
Basically to do that, I need to get_node the node that is the current tab, so I can address the correct instance.

Is there a way to do that in godot? I can't seem to find it.

If not, would it be possible to add it as a new method? It would be very helpful.

data.title: Curve2D/3D: Add clear_points method.
data.body:
Adds a method to the Curve2D and Curve3D classes to easily clear the curve.
So you don't have to remove each point manually.

data.title: fix for crash when no ALSA or Pulse installed on linux
data.body:
When no ALSA or Pulse libraries are installed on Linux. Godot (x11 version) will crash, since no audio driver can be loaded.
By loading the dummy audio driver (used in Godot's server version), when no other driver is available, we avoid this issue.

May be related to #1684

data.title: Shape2D added to CollisionObject2D do not appear with Visual Collision enabled.
data.body:
Running Windows 7 SP1 x64, Godot 2.1.1 stable

If I use GDScript to add a Shape2D to, for example, an Area2D, it does trigger collisions but it's "hitbox" is not shown when Visual Collision is enabled.

Having to work around by adding a CollisionShape2D feels kinda dirty. 
Please look into it. Thanks.

`shape = CircleShape2D.new()`
`shape.set_radius(400)`
`self.add_shape(shape)`
Works fine, but not visible.

`shape = CircleShape2D.new()`
`shape.set_radius(400)`
`collision = CollisionShape2D.new()`
`collision = set_shape(shape)`
`self.add_child(collision)`
Works and is visible, but feels weird to use an "editor helper" class for something done in code.

data.title: Added rad2vec and deg2vec functionality to gdscript and visualscript
data.body:
Implemented and tested rad2vec and deg2vec functionality. I couldn't figure out how to get visual_script to draw lines in a test environment, so it remains untested there, but it worked in GDScript. The implementations are extremely similar, so I don't foresee the functions not working in visual_script.

I used the exact naming in the feature request. Considering that this is a 2d and 3d environment, it may better serve to specify "rad2vec2" and "deg2vec2" instead.

Implements #7263.

data.title: *.TSCN extension filter not present when loading Resource exports in editor
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Ubuntu Linux x86_64

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
When using export(Resource) in a GDScript file and then trying to load a tscn file into the property in the editor, the file dialog does not have a filter for *.tscn file extensions. If I select to show all files and select a tscn file it works as expected. A filter to tscn files should be added to that file dialog.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1) Open the linked example project (ResourceFileSceneBug)
2) Load the Main.tscn file
3) Click on the Node in the Scene view window
4) In the inspector, click the drop down for the "Set To Instance Scene" property and scroll down and click load
5) Notice that there is a filter for *.scn files but not one for *tscn files
6) If you use the filter "All Files (*)", you will see the InstanceScene.tscn file that you can select and it works

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
[ResourceFileSceneBug.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/644142/ResourceFileSceneBug.zip)

data.title: Spatial.look_at and Translate result in rotation seemingly being interpolated
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Manjaro, Godot 2.1

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Translating the node in the same frame as calling `look_at` in results in the object (maybe ?) being interpolated.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Call `look_at` and either manually translate by calculating the offset and calling `set_translation` or `global_translate` in the same `_process` call.

**[Video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wy1nhFdu7uc)**

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
You can find a simple reproducible project with the same code as in the video in this small repo here:

https://github.com/iboshkov/GodotLookatDemo

Fixes neikeq/GodotSharp#11

`ptrcall` is strict with the types, so a wrong method bind is deadly.

data.title: Fixes and improvementes for IPv6 implementation.
data.body:
I've been working on this patch for a while now, this PR includes some bugfix for the IPv6 implementation and some design improvements.

- **[FIX]** StreamPeerTCP `get_connected_host` and `get_connnected_port` reporting wrong value
- **[FIX]** Hostname resolution failing on Android
- **[FIX]** StreamPeerTCP `connect` function properly handle disconnect when connection refused/connection reset/network unreachable etc (for now only reporting a generic STATUS_ERROR).
- **[FIX]** Hostname resolution cache is now specific for IP type.
- **[DESIGN]** PacketPeerUDP/StreamPeerTCP/TCP_Server now uses an instance variable
to store the selected ip_type (IPv4/IPv6/ANY, where ANY = dual stack), instead of having to pass the parameter to all the functions (listen/connect/set_send_address). Each class will always use the specified ip_type when resolving hostnames, setting sockets, sending data.
- **[DESIGN]** IP_Address now handle IPv4 and IPv6 transparently:
  - Converts to and from String transparently while handling IPv4 addresses as IPv6 mapped (::ffff:[IP]) internally.
  - Setting/Getting of ip array is now only possible through dedicated functions (ie. set_ipv4, get_ipv4, set_ipv6, get_ipv6)
  - Add function to know if the address is a valid IPv4 (for IP implementation and enet, will soon switch to dual stack for the latter).
- **[REFACTOR]** `IP_Address::AddrType` enum moved `IP::Type` (GDScript `int.IP_TYPE_* -> IP.TYPE_*`)

I know it's quite a patch, but it guarantees that we **handle IP addresses consistently** and each socket type will **use the appropriate format** for it when possible.
**Hostname resolution** will also always be **correct for the given type** (assuming resolution for that type is possible at all).

A test project for TCP/UDP is available here:
https://github.com/Faless/gd-v6test
I tested Linux, Android, OSX and Windows (native 7/10 and with Wine). UWP also seems to build fine.
I can't test iOS but I see no reason why it should not work since it worked before (and also, it still works on Mac).

We still default to dual stack socket, which works out of the box on all officially supported platform for what I can tell.
If a specific socket type is required it's still possible to use it by calling `set_ip_type` on the UDP/TCP classes, and the HTTP (client/request) classes.

I'd love a review from @punto- .
@akien-mga please let me know if you prefer me to squash some commits.
Any comment is welcome, because if there are some mistakes left I really can't see them after working on this and self-reviewing it so much :8ball:

data.title: Add support for Android non-Neon devices without compiling a new template
Non-realtime simulation
data.body:
Added support for running Godot as a game simulator.

Two cmd-line flags can be set to use the functionality
- fixed_fps [int fps]: can be set to disable the frame delay turning the application into a non-realtime one.
- disable_render_loop: can be set to disable rendering completely in the main loop, speeding up the
 simulation.

The fps set, is the frames pr. game second, allowing the game to speed up or slow down 
according to processing speed.
It is useful for using Godot to simulate many game outcomes quickly, which can f.ex. be used for AI 
training.

We can also render frames to files using these flags, by controlling the rendering from script (i used a 
simple .gd script in my project that queued a screenshot, called draw, and then got the screenshot in the 
_process() function)

data.title: Two scenes loading eachother (using export) causes Crash
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
2.1.1 stable (on Steam)

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
When I hit play, the game freezes and will not start.
 I have no idea what causes this, but I suspect it has something with using **export (PackedScene),** and having the scenes reference each-other. What is supposed to happen, is that scene_1 is supposed to change to scene_2 when pressing space (ui_select) - and scene_2 to change back to 1 when pressing space again. I would understand why this would happen if they would automatically load eachother (thus causing a loop), but neither scene is instancing the other at startup, so it is odd.

**_Edit 1:_** I can confirm that it still crashes, even if I do not run any code. It is definitely because of the e**xport (PackedScene)** that refer each-other.

**_Edit 2:_** If you change the next_scene inside scene_2.tscn
  `export (PackedScene) var next_scene`
into 
  `onready var next_scene = preload("res://scene_1/scene_1.tscn")`
It works perfectly. It has something to do with export. 

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Download project files:
[Scene Transitioning - Bug.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/639481/Scene.Transitioning.-.Bug.zip)

2. Hit play.
